video.title: MongoDB Full Tutorial w/ Node.js, Express, & Mongoose
video.description:
In this tutorial, we implement a basic Mongo DB with Node/Express project and fully deploy it to the Turbo staging environment.

Mongo DB (the "M" in MEAN and MERN stack) is among the most dominant databases in use today. Along with MySQL and PostgreSQL, Mongo DB an industry-standard database consideration among startups and large companies alike. But unlike the other two, Mongo DB is the de-facto standard for document based databases and has exploded in popularity since its release in 2009. 

💻Files: https://www.mediafire.com/folder/7lxecwj9n7heq/MongoDB_Tutorial

🔗https://www.turbo360.co/

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) 1. Installation
⌨️ (04:38) 2. Project Setup
⌨️ (10:59) 3. Profile Schema
⌨️ (21:33) 4. Seed Data
⌨️ (30:08) 5. Queries
⌨️ (37:40) 6. ID Queries
⌨️ (42:32) 7. Creating Data
⌨️ (51:27) 8. Updating Data
⌨️ (58:00) 9. Removing Data
⌨️ (1:04:05) 10. Deployment

Tutorial developed by Dan Kwon from Turbo 360. Check out their YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCf5CgGVs6zEq6DUtyFw9e-Q/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Colin May
topLevelComment.text: This tutorial uses MLab for cloud DB deployment. MLab has now been absorbed into MongoDB (the organization/corporation), and although the website still exists, when you go to sign up, it directs you to the MongoDB Atlas sign-up page. From there, the UI is quite different, although functionally similar. Anyway, it makes the last section of the video hard to follow.

topLevelComment.author: hmod
topLevelComment.text:
Hello i have a quick question, 

Everytime i edit something and want to see the update on the turbo server it keeps saying port 3000 already in use and i have to shutdown the server and re-launch it.
This issue does not pop up in the video, anyone know how to fix it ?


Thank  you.

replies.author: Adil L
replies.text:
For better development install nodemon to automatically restart server 
 •  npm i -D nodemon 
  ○ -D : is for Development Dependency( because it wont be used in production )
 • To use, you need to add a script to package.json
  ○ "dev": "nodemon index.js",
In terminal you need to type: npm run dev

topLevelComment.author: Doug Smithers
topLevelComment.text:
I came unstuck at 9:50. After failing to connect to the server, as directed, I typed 'mongod' into my terminal and received the following output. I couldn't connect to the server as instructed and had to bail from there.

ME:mongo-proj me$ mongod
2018-09-22T14:59:56.036+1000 I CONTROL  [main] Automatically disabling TLS 1.0, to force-enable TLS 1.0 specify --sslDisabledProtocols 'none'
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] MongoDB starting : pid=23178 port=27017 dbpath=/data/db 64-bit host=Administrators-MacBook-Pro.local
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] db version v4.0.2
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] git version: fc1573ba18aee42f97a3bb13b67af7d837826b47
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] allocator: system
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] modules: none
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] build environment:
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten]     distarch: x86_64
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten]     target_arch: x86_64
2018-09-22T14:59:56.104+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] options: {}
2018-09-22T14:59:56.107+1000 I STORAGE  [initandlisten] exception in initAndListen: NonExistentPath: Data directory /data/db not found., terminating
2018-09-22T14:59:56.108+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] now exiting
2018-09-22T14:59:56.108+1000 I CONTROL  [initandlisten] shutting down with code:100

Any help with that out there?

replies.author: Mimi T K
replies.text:
I had the same problem and fixed it, go to the command-prompt ,type in : mkdir C:\data\db


it should work perfectly :)

topLevelComment.author: Chunky Chunk
topLevelComment.text: Mongoose reference suggests using "findByIdAndDelete" methods over "findByIdAndRemove" methods, although they also state both will accomplish about the same thing.  Also, deleting or removing a record will return the record that was deleted or removed.
